title: European core network corridors - enablers for all stakeholders?
arranger: Botniska korridoren, Näringslivets transportråd, Norrbotniabanan, Nya Ostkustbanan
description:
What impacts and benefits do we get from these corridors, the core network and the financial instruments that accompany those? Is this important for the European, Swedish, Norwegian and Finnish infrastructure, politics, 
companies and organisations?
extendedDescription:
The European Union, together with the Member States, have identified nine geographical and two 
horizontal corridors for increased growth and prosperity through a more efficient transport system in 
Europe. Along with the TEN-T core network, these corridors provide an infrastructure for sustainable 
transport for Europe's future growth, completed in 2030. 
Sweden and Finland are covered by the horizontal and two of the geographical corridors, the 
Scandinavian-Mediterranian corridor reaching Oslo, Örebro, Stockholm and Helsinki-, and the North 
Sea Baltic corridor that reaches Helsinki. Together with the Bothnian extension and the Iron ore line 
from the port of Lulea to the port of Narvik they make up the TEN-T core network in Sweden and Finland.
